author: Staff Reporter
text:
Collector and District Election Officer Sajjansingh R. Chavan at the programme to paste SVEEP stickers on cash bags of TNSTC conductors in Nagercoil on Monday.

As part of the Systematic Voter Education and Electoral Participation (SVEEP) programme to improve the voter turnout, the district administration has been taking various measures in the past fortnight.

The Collector Sajjansingh R. Chavan initiated pasting of SVEEP stickers on the cash bags of Tamil Nadu State Transport Corporation (TNSTC) bus conductors at Anna Bus stand here on Monday.

Speaking on the occasion, Mr. Chavan said that the cash bags of all the 2457 conductors will sport SVEEP stickers. Earlier, Mr. Chavan initiated various awareness activities, including rallies and human chains by students, awareness through cultural programmes and door-to-door campaign on voting through SHGs.

The cash bags of all the 2457 conductors of TNSTC working in 12 depots across the district will sport the SVEEP stickers. The collector also distributed pamphlets on awareness of voting to passengers of TNSTC buses. District Revenue Officer S. Elango, TNSTC General Manager, Nagercoil Region, P. Thiruvalamban, Returning Officers Shreya P. Singh (Padmanabhapuram) and S. Madhiayazhagan (Nagercoil) and other government officials were also present.
title: SVEEP stickers on cash bags of conductors
